intro: Phyllactis obovata, commonly known as the broad-ovate phyllactis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apocynaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that contains toxic alkaloids, which can be harmful to humans and animals. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and traditional medicine practices.
